author: Ha876
title: Bullseye
review: The ninja training outpost is the smallest of the current ninjago but that doesn't mean that its bad by any means. It contains one minifig named Cole who is the leader of the group of 4 ninjas. One of the cool parts about this set is the fact that it comes with 5 weapons and a scorpion(???). The weapons being a bow and arrow, 2 knives, a spear, and a sword(japanese looking). Also, there is target board where the ninja can practice chucking his weapons at. I like how the coloring on it isn't the traditional red and white. The weapons rack/station isn't much but it has a neatly designed lamp(again japanese style) on it. All in all this set is worth getting as a start-off to your ninjago collection.

author: HeroFactoryDude316
title: Weapon Master!
review:
I got this little set the other day at Wal Mart. It's a neat set but let's let you decide.

Minifigs:Cole: Cole is a good figure but he's the classic ninja. Plain black and with a place to hold a sword.4/5

Target: This is a smart design. Easy to make yet fun. However the weapons don't stick into it as shown on the box.4/5

Weapon stand: This stand is good. The scorpion is nice and the arsenal of weapons is good. The barrel is there to hold some weapons is what I'm guessing.5/5

Overall: Overall It's a good little set and I advise getting it.4/5

author: jteisberg
title: Set X4!
review: One thing that the other reviews seemed to miss. Is that on the two flat sides there is a pin brick and a brick with a hole in it.  It seems that if someone got 4 of this set, they would all connect to make one big weapon thingy.  the baceplates would also make a perfect circlelike bace.   buy this set 1/4 buy 4 4/4! make super training center!

author: legodude357
title: A nice set to get back into this hobby.
review:
I recently stopped collecting legos for the past 3+++ months and this was my first set to buy after getting into this hobby agian. This was also my first 2011 set.

 

Upon seeing the package, for some reason it was hard to see what was on it! I guess my eyes aren't yet  adjusted to the 2011 very vivid packaging.

 

The intructions are step by step, no miststakes, and a very skilled lego builder like myself could put this set together in just a few seconds. Literally, its extremely simple.

 

Playability was surprisingly high! I had a great time pretending cole was throwing his knives at the target then walking up to retreive them, but BOOM. A scorpion is resting by the target. A big one too...

 

The build was plain and didn't contain any surprises. But I did notice little technic pins and holes on the side. Which means this set could link up to another one of this set itself or the dojo set.

 

All in all this would be a pretty average set, but if it was just a tad cheaper, it could be amazing! But as we all know lego's been raising the price on everything. Or maybe its not lego... Maybe its all the taxes or inflation thats been going on shortly. Anyways, I reccomend this set as a treat for a child, a set to keep you busy, or to start your Ninjago collection!

author: AETerry
title: Ninja Training Outpost Review
review:
At $4.99, this is the smallest of the new Ninjago playsets wtih 45 pieces. So it's not bad for it's size and value. The final result does look a bit thin. But there are a bunch of accessories to give the impression of a training post, a scorpion piece and a target build for the Ninja minifigure Cole to train at. I noted a clever use of round element pieces to convey the look of a japanese paper lantern hanging from a pole. The base of the set have technic pieces and connecting pin suggesting that this set can be attached to a much larger set such as the Dojo playset I've seen or if you wanted, you could buy 3 more of these and connect them all to form a circular post.

 

It's not a bad introduction to the Ninjago series and makes it worth or tempting to consider picking up more sets in the series.

author: TooMuchLEGO
title: You must train, Young Ninja, in this awesome starter set!
review:
This was my introduction to the LEGO NinjaGo Universe, along with Spinjitzu Dojo and Ninja Ambush. This set is quite good. 
For starters, you get Cole, a fearless leader, who comes equipped with a bow and arrow. There is also a weapon stand with two knives, a spear, and a black katana. Also included is a brown bucket- this bucket is used to hold more weapons. On the weapons rack lies a poisonous scorpion.
The build is simple, fast, and fun. If you get more than one of this set, you can make a tower. Awesome!
This set is a great way to get started on LEGO Ninjago. I recommend getting it 100%!

author: davy_jones
title: Weapons galore
review:
Set 2516 is the smallest box set in the Ninjago theme. Besides the box sets, the theme also carries bubble wrapped individual character packs with weapons and stat cards. The set comes with a six page instruction booklet, one minifig, weapon holder and target.
The Cole minifig is cool due in large part to his black color scheme. This is further complemented by the scowl on his little head just in case the cover is blown. The main part of the setting is the weapon holder. This is a clever little design, demonstrating what can be achieved with few parts if creative thought is applied. The pieces 4211087 and 4211111 which are at the base, allow multiple units like this to be combined into one ferocious weapons storage facility.

Pros
 
Weapons galore; the list reads: 1 spear, 2 daggers/knives, 1 bow and 1 katana
Cole minifig
Nice color combo for the weapon holder and has a little barrel as well
Lantern is a nice touch on the weapon holder
Good value for money
 

Cons
The target design is a bit gaudy. Since Cole is mastering the Spinjitzu element of earth the colors could be brown or tan which is more in line with his quest and will give the overall 'old world' look to the set.

Note:
Get this set folks. If budget permits, get many. Think about it, ninjas are always shown to appear in groups with black overalls and carrying all sorts of weapons. So with many Coles, you effectively get a covert Cole army. Multiple units of this set will extensively add to your weapon inventory as well. Plus its not really costly.

author: LobsterWarrior
title: "A MUST HAVE!"
review:
This is a MUST-HAVE SET! Good if you missed out on the ORIGINAL ninja theme, whether you want more ninjas, you want an awesome set on a budget, or if you want a cheap training outport to base your training base on , or if you just want an archer ninja! This is also a GREAT starter set for those starting a ninjago collection. This set has so many awesome weapons, not too common and not too rare, just the right balance! The outpost is well-built, and the arching thing is awesome!

Pros

-Great ninja!

-Weapons arent too common or too rare!

-Well-built outpost and archer thing!

-Awesome training outpost!

-Great to introduce Ninjago!

Cons

-Could use a skeleton, but hey, its a $5.00 set.

 

So, if you really aren't the biggest fan of skeletons, get this set ASAP!

author: IndyAJD
title: The coolest $5.00 set EVER!!
review:
Okay, this set is awesome! The price is great, the parts are great, its an easy but fun build, and its playability is pretty good.

The design of this set is great! It really has an Asian look to it, especially the lantern hanging from the outpost. The target is pretty cool as well!

Pros

  • Great Asian looking design.
  • Can connect to other Ninjago sets.
  • Accessories GALORE!! (2 knives, 1 spear, 1 ninja sword, a bow, a barrel, and a scorpion!)
  • The target is well designed as well.
  • Great Cole minifig!
  • Great price!

Cons

  • Does not include an enemy for Cole to fight, (thus the playability rating) but given the price, this is not a big deal.  Its a Ninja, so even conducting his training can be fun!

Overall, I definitely would recommend this set to any lego fan.  If you are looking for a cheap set that is just AMAZING, this is the set for you.

author: pixarcars8191
title: cole the black ninja with his training post
review: Ok my dad got me this set and i think it's pretty awesome it comes with five weapons a target also a bug and don't forget cole and the weapon holder and it has a spot to connect it with other ninjago sets and that's why i think this set is cool

author: Ant4fatony
title: A nice Start
review:
The Ninja Training Outpost is a fun start to the Ninjago series. I very much enjoy the new pieces and weapons which really get the ninja off to a solid foundation of being awesome and able to kick some butt. I also like the very clever use of minor pieces to create an Asian architecture. The bamboo look and especially the Chinese lantern give this small set a great deal of visual appeal. You get a total of 5 great weapons. In fact I am going to use him with my pirate sets, to bring a deadly Eastern flare. I also like the addition of "extra" pieces that are very useful and not necessary but very much appreciated, the barrel and the scorpion. Both really increase the playability of the set. Well done.

 

I only have two problems with the set:

 

*Dislike the target. Sure the colors match, but it does not look or feel like a true target. a printed tile would have been better.

 

*The ninja has a bow and arrow, but no quiver like you found with castle and Islander sets.

author: SeptimusHeap
title: Great Cheap Set
review:
My brother got this set a few days ago.

Building

The build is decent, probably the best you could get for a set of this size. There are some interesting SNOT techniques in the archery target, and you can connect 4 of the stands to make a small lookout tower.

Parts

The best part of this set is the parts. You get a ninja mask, which is always great, a bow, a black katana, a spear, and my favorite part, the double throwing knives. They could be a great supply of Spinjitzu weapons. You also get a "Black Brick, Modified 1 x 2 x 2/3 with Studs on Sides", which looks like a camera, and a leaves piece.

Figs

The only fig in this set is the black ninja, Cole. He is carrying a bow and arrow, which fits nicely on the clip on the back of the mask. He has a sort of glaring face. His torso is a robe, and his legs have a belt printed on the belt piece, with ends going down onto the legs.

Weapon Stand

The weapon stand is a nice accessory, it has a barrel, clips for the knives, spear, and katana, and a lantern hanging from it.

Archery Target

The target is a nice small addition, nothing special, but the target does bend between the target and the base.

author: SKip_E_Productions2
title: Wow!
review:
"ninja training outpost" is a really cool ninjago impulse set. it comes with cole and his pet scorpion, a small pillar holding a black katana, black spear, and two bowie knives, a bow and arrow, a target, and a barrel to hold other weapons.

 

the thing that's nice about this set is that it's pretty detailed for such a tiny set. it has a chinese paper lantern made out of studs, a little plant, and you can even connect four together and make a tower. overall, it's a nice set. i just wished it had a spinner and maybe two skeletons for target practice. yet, it's very much worth $5 and is a good buy. you'll probably spend forever playing with it.

 

worth the money! buy it!

author: gubbywub
title: Not a must have, but a nice set
review:
Good set, Not a must have, like I said. Onto the pros and cons

Pros

  • cheap
  • lots of weapons
  • can be connected to ninja battle arena

Cons

  • small
  • not much playability
  • nothing much you couldn't get in another set

 

 

    In conclusion, If your going to collect, or if you want cole, this is a good set

 

 

                    8/10

author: Dragon_Master_48
title: A Rather Simple Set, Although Very "To The Point."
review:
2516 Ninja Training Outpost is one of the smallest boxed sets in the initial wave of 2011 Ninjago sets. Although it's not much, it's a fair introduction to the theme, and a good add-on for those who have already started collecting the theme.

There's not too much to this set that you wouldn't expect: it's is easy to build, and features a simple tower or outpost on a base, and a target, presumably for the bow and arrow or throwing knives. One interesting feature on this set is the Technic pin piece sticking out of one side (and a Technic brick with hole on the other). Although I personally do not have any of the sets this feature can be used with, I find it interesting how this set might attach to other sets- although its small size might hinder it more when doing so, as it might get "swallowed up" compared to these larger sets.

The Cole minifigure is a nice inclusion, as I am a fan of Cole, and he blends in nicely with the general color scheme of this set.

Pros

  • Cole minifigure.
  • Variety of weapons ensures that something interesting will always be going on.

Cons

  • Scorpion doesn't fit well in this set.
  • A bit small-looking by itself.

Overall, although this set includes a lot of weapons and a good minifigures, it might be a little underwhelming to some people by itself. Don't misjudge this set, though: it has some nice pieces, good rebuild potential, and goes great with other Ninjago sets.

author: e01
title: Good Pieces, Small Price
review: This set has a ninja, weapons, archery target, and has a good amount of pieces for a small price. Buy it if you are wandering around and see it on the shelf above you. The price is only seven or eight dollars but the ninjago dojo is cool because you can connect it with other ninjago sets as well.

author: legolover2001
title: Little bit of a let down
review:
This was my first Ninjago set i ever got. It is always nice to get your first set from a new theme because you think it is going to be a great set and usually they are but unfortunately this wasn't.

Pros

You get loads of weapons (A sword, a spear, two knives and a bow arrow).
Cool figure.

Cons

Weapon holder looks strange.
Scorpion is doesn't fit into the scene.

Overall, the set is ok but the only reasons you wold probably buy it is for the weapons.

author: legoyt
title: A good set to collect
review:
This is a good set. It was my first Ninjago set.

Pros:
Cole
Arrow
Knifes
Target
Cons:
Playability

This is a good set to collect

title: PRIMO SET NINKJAGO

author: 101ThePolybagCollector101
title: Lego Ninjago - 2516 - Ninja Training Outpost Review
review:
Hello and Welcome to this Review of the Lego Ninjago 2516 Ninja Training Outpost by Me, 101ThePolybagCollector101.

The Minifigure:

The Minifigure included in this set is Cole. This version of Cole is from the first ever wave of Ninjago so it is quite basic. He includes his black mask which has very high details on it to show that it is cotton or cloth and it is completely Black. His face is a mysterious, yet stunning face which had a scratch down it. His Torso has five streaks of rope on it which connect to a dragon-like badge on the front. Around that it is also ALL black. His Pants are black with a white belt on it. Overall, a very stunning minifigure.

The Set:

The set consists of a target for Cole to hit with his brown, detailed bow he is holding. The target is a easy to build but affective piece of the set and is the main part of the whole set. It uses a camera piece they used in Lego studios set at the bottom which you can see is holding the target up. Also, on the right of the picture, there is a detailed stand that is holding all of Coles accessories and weapons for him. The accessories/weapons include: A brown barrel, a black scorpion, a black machete, the brown bow which Cole is holding, a black spear and two hand-knives. Also, at the bottom there is a plant sticking out which gives it a nice effect. You might see that there is two clips on the stand. Well, they are to connect another one of those sets onto it and if you get four, you can have a complete circle of weapons and accessories which is a great feature, overall this set is Awesome!

The Price:

I think, personally that the price is a good price for this set if you live in Great Britain because the PPP (Price Per Piece) ratio is 8p PP which is great but in the US, $4.99 takes the PPP to 11 Cents per piece which is dissapointing. Apart from that, their is no problems with this set.

The Final Rating: I rate this set a 8/10 because it has a great amount of accessories and detail but there is hardly any playability features and the US price is a bit high. Apart from that, this set is amazing :-)

Thankyou for reading and if you have time, check out my Brickset Profile or my Youtube account: https://www.youtube.com/user/ThePolybagCollector?feature=mhee and Please Subscribe and keep building!

-Connor Bak; KFOL

author: Wreckagestudios
title: Ninja Training Outpost-OK set
review: Ninja Training Outpost is an OK set. It includes five weapons (one bow,one spear, one black katana and two daggers). There is a place to hold all of the weapons apart from the bow which Cole, the earth ninja, carries. There is a target for Cole to shoot at with the bow. There is one minifig in the set. Cole has a black mask the same as the classic ninja theme. There are sashes across his torso and an earth symbol. The hips and legs have grey belt printed on them. Overall, I think this set is Ok for its price but I wish that it had one more ninja in it.

author: RaiderOfTheLostBrick
title: Little play value, but still looks good.
review:
I was really interested in the Ninjago line for the first few years, but haven’t really touched it since my 2015-2016 dark age. This was my first set from the line and I thought it would be nice to review since I’ve just repaired it.

The Good:

- Very cheap back in the day ($8 AUD)

- Cheapest way to get Cole at the time, but he looks a little outdated now.

-Lots of interesting pieces, from weapons to the barrel and scorpion.

- Build looks nice and can be connected to other variants of this set.

The Bad:

- No play features.

Overall:

The Ninja Training Outpost was certainly a good way to get Cole and some cool parts back in the day for some loose change. The builds still look good, but the set’s lack of play value is annoying. Maybe a small missile feature would have made this set a bit better. But other than this omission, this set should still appeal to several Ninjago fans.
